metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4303 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The parse_string function in cjson.c in the cJSON library mishandles UTF8/16 strings, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or execute arbitrary code via a non-hex character in a JSON string, which triggers a heap-based buffer overflow. It was discovered that iperf mishandled certain UTF8 and UTF16 strings. A remote attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4303` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

iperf3 - 3.0.11-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libiperf0 - 3.0.11-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: iperf3 package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.11-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
